title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon National Parks: Buckeye Flat Campground
body: Buckeye Flat Campground       Buckeye Flat campground is located 4 miles (6.5 km) from the Sequoia National Park entrance. The campground is situated on the Middle Fork of the Kaweah River under an open stand of oaks.      Region   Foothills area in Sequoia National Park     Elevation   2,800 ft. (843 m)     Open   March 16 - September 28, 2016. Gates open or close at noon on campground opening and closing dates.     Reservations   Reservations available 5/25/2016 - 9/27/2016.  See below for reservation info. First-come, first-serve outside of reservation dates.     Fee   $22/night     Number of sites   28     RV/Trailer length   Tents only     Pets   Permitted (Learn more about pet regulations)     Dump station   Yes     Groceries   Three Rivers or Lodgepole     Showers   No     Accessibility   Site #20 is suitable for wheelchairs     Ranger Programs   None     Phone   Nearest phone is at Hospital Rock     Restrooms   Flush toilets     Food storage   Large food locker - 47"W x 33"D x 28"H     Parking is limited to one vehicle per site. Extra parking is available at Hospital Rock. Do not park on the road to the campground. You are required to store food properly in order to protect bears. Learn more about bears and food storage in the parks. You may make reservations starting 6 months in advance of the date you would like to camp. For example, reservations for July 4 can be made starting January 4. Reservations: Go online to Recreation.gov or call toll free: 877-444-6777 (TDD 877-833-6777) from 10 a.m. - midnight EST March 1 through October 31, or 10 a.m. - 10 p.m. EST November 1 through February. Customer Service: 888-448-1474. Download the Buckeye Flat campground map for a larger, printable image. (PDF)
